intro: Hieracium hedypnoides, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium hedypnoides is often considered an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance.
